text: The arrondissement of Saint-Claude is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Jura département in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region. Its capital, and subprefecture of the department, is the city of Saint-Claude. ==History== When the arrondissements of Jura were created in 1800, Saint-Claude was one of them in the Jura department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Saint-Claude is in the southwest of the Jura département; it is the smaller arrondissement with an area of . It has a population of 50,909 inhabitants, the arrondissement with fewest people living in it, and a population density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement of Saint-Claude is bordered to the north and west by the arrondissement Lons-le-Saunier, to the east by Switzerland and to the south by the Ain département. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Saint-Claude, there are five cantons and three of them have all their "communes" in the arrondissement: # Moirans- en-Montagne (3909) (partly) # Morez (3911) # Saint-Claude (3914) # Saint- Laurent-en-Grandvaux (3915) (partly) # Saint-Lupicin (3916) ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Saint-Claude has 60 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): # Avignon-lès-Saint-Claude (39032) #
